Cube Module

Cube Module Components

Module for Cube processes.

class sysame.cube.cube.Node(string, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Simple node class for representing network nodes.

Parameters:

  • string (str or int) -- String representation of the node.

  • **kwargs (dict) -- Additional attributes to be assigned to the node.

id

Node identifier, absolute value from string.

Type:

int

stopping

Whether the node is a stopping point.

Type:

bool

_string

Internal storage of the original string representation.

Type:

str

property attrs: dict[str, Any]

Returns a dictionary with user-defined attributes.

Returns:

Dictionary of custom attributes excluding internal ones.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

copy()[source]

Create a deep copy of the node.

Returns:

A new instance that is a deep copy of this node.

Return type:

Node

class sysame.cube.cube.Line(nodes, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: object

Simple line class representing a sequence of nodes.

A line is a sequence of nodes with its own properties.

Parameters:

  • nodes (list of Node) -- List of node objects that form the line.

  • **kwargs (dict) -- Additional attributes to be assigned to the line.

nodes

List of nodes that form the line.

Type:

list of Node

name

Name of the line (set via kwargs).

Type:

str

unquoted

Class variable that defines values that should not be quoted.

Type:

list of str

NodeLabel

Label to identify nodes in string representation.

Type:

str

Initialize a line object.

Parameters:

  • nodes (list[Node]) -- List of node objects that form the line.

  • **kwargs (dict) -- Additional attributes to be assigned to the line.

unquoted = ['T', 'F']
NodeLabel = 'N'
property attrs: dict[str, Any]

Returns a dictionary with user-defined attributes.

Returns:

Dictionary of line attributes excluding nodes and internal ones.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

property stops: list[Node]

Returns a list of the nodes that are actual stops.

Returns:

List of nodes marked as stopping points.

Return type:

list[Node]

is_node(n)[source]

Returns True if n is one of the line's nodes.

Parameters:

n (Node or int) -- Node or node ID to check.

Returns:

True if the node is part of the line, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

is_stop(n)[source]

Returns True if line stops at n.

Parameters:

n (Node or int) -- Node or node ID to check.

Returns:

True if the node is a stopping point on the line, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

property stop_seq: str

Returns a concatenation of line's stops.

Parameters:

sep (str, default="_") -- Separator to use between stop IDs.

Returns:

Concatenated string of stop IDs.

Return type:

str

static from_string(string, potential_seps=None)[source]

Parse a string representation into a line object.

Parameters:

  • string (str) -- String to parse.

  • potential_seps (Optional[list[str]], default=None) -- List of potential separators to detect.

Returns:

Parsed line object.

Return type:

Line

Raises:

AssertionError -- If invalid node declarations are found.

copy()[source]

Create a deep copy of the line.

Returns:

A new instance that is a deep copy of this line.

Return type:

Line

class sysame.cube.cube.LineFile(content=None)[source]

Bases: object

Class representing a file of lines.

A LineFile is a collection of line objects and comments.

Parameters:

content (list of (Line or str), optional) -- List of line objects and comment strings.

content

List containing line objects and comment strings.

Type:

list of (Line or str)

property content_duplicates_renamed: list[Line | str]

Returns the LineFile's content with duplicated NAMEs renamed.

Returns:

Copy of content with renamed lines.

Return type:

list

rename_duplicates()[source]

Changes the LineFile's content to avoid lines with duplicated NAMEs.

Return type:

None

property name_unique: bool

Returns True if lines' property "NAME" is a unique identifier.

Returns:

True if all line names are unique, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

property comments: list[str]

Returns the list of comments in the file.

Returns:

All comments in the file.

Return type:

list of str

property lines: dict[str, Line]

Returns a dictionary of lines by NAME.

Returns:

Dictionary of lines with NAME as key.

Return type:

Dict[str, Line]

property lines_duplicates_renamed: dict[str, Line]

Returns a dictionary of lines with duplicated NAMEs renamed.

Returns:

Dictionary of lines with NAME as key, duplicates renamed.

Return type:

Dict[str, Line]

property line_names: list[str]

Returns a list of line names as strings.

Preserves order. May contain duplicates.

Returns:

List of line names.

Return type:

list[str]

copy()[source]

Create a deep copy of the LineFile.

Returns:

A new instance that is a deep copy of this LineFile.

Return type:

LineFile

save(path, sort=False, comments=True, node_attrs=None, exclude_node_attrs=None, line_attrs=None, exclude_line_attrs=None, rename_duplicates=True)[source]

Save the LineFile to a file.

Parameters:

  • path (str) -- Path to the output file.

  • sort (bool, default=False) -- If True, sorts the output.

  • comments (bool, default=True) -- If True, includes comments in the output.

  • node_attrs (list of str, optional) -- List of node attributes to include.

  • exclude_node_attrs (list of str, optional) -- List of node attributes to omit.

  • line_attrs (list of str, optional) -- List of line attributes to include.

  • exclude_line_attrs (list of str, optional) -- List of line attributes to omit.

  • rename_duplicates (bool, default=True) -- If True, renames duplicate line names.

Return type:

None

lines_by_attr(attr, val)[source]

Returns a list of lines having a specific value in an attribute.

Parameters:

  • attr (str) -- Attribute name to check.

  • val (Any) -- Value to match.

Returns:

List of lines that match the criteria.

Return type:

list[Line]

lines_query(qry)[source]

Returns a list of lines meeting a SQL-like query.

This relies on pandas DataFrame query:

https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/generated/pandas.DataFrame.query.html

Parameters:

qry (str) -- SQL-like query string.

Returns:

List of lines that match the query.

Return type:

list[Line]

property df: DataFrame

Returns a dataframe with the attributes for each line.

Returns:

DataFrame containing line attributes as columns.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

static from_string(string)[source]

Create a LineFile from a string.

Parameters:

string (str) -- String representation of a line file.

Returns:

Parsed LineFile object.

Return type:

LineFile

static read_file(path)[source]

Read a line file from disk.

Parameters:

path (str) -- Path to the file.

Returns:

Parsed LineFile object from the file.

Return type:

LineFile

sysame.cube.cube.process_cube_routes(voyager_exe, routes_print_file, outputs_routes_file=None)[source]

Parse and format Cube routes.

Parameters:

  • voyager_exe (Path) -- Path to voyager executable

  • routes_print_file (Path) -- Path to Cube routes file

  • outputs_routes_file (Path | None) -- Path to output routes file. If None, will use the same path as routes_print_file.

Raises:

RuntimeError -- When Cube fails

Return type:

None

sysame.cube.cube.network_to_shapefile(voyager_exe, network_file, nodes_file=None, links_file=None, projection_string=None)[source]

Export Cube network to Links and Nodes shapefiles.

Parameters:

  • voyager_exe (Path) -- Path to voyager executable

  • network_file (Path) -- Path to run folder

  • nodes_file (Path) -- Path to nodes shapefile

  • links_file (Path) -- Path to links shapefile

  • projection_string (Optional[str]) -- projection string to use for shapefiles

Raises:

RuntimeError -- When Cube fails

Return type:

None

sysame.cube.cube.export_network_to_csvs(voyager_exe, network_file, nodes_file=None, links_file=None)[source]

Export Cube network to Links and Nodes CSVs.

Parameters:

  • voyager_exe (Path) -- Path to voyager executable

  • network_file (Path) -- Path to run folder

  • nodes_file (Path) -- Path to nodes CSV

  • links_file (Path) -- Path to links CSV

Raises:

RuntimeError -- When Cube fails

Return type:

None

sysame.cube.cube.build_network_from_csvs(voyager_exe, links_file, nodes_file, network_path, links_var, nodes_var)[source]

Build Cube network from links and nodes CSVs.

Parameters:

  • voyager_exe (Path) -- Path to voyager executable

  • links_file (Path) -- Path to links CSV

  • nodes_file (Path) -- Path to nodes CSV

  • network_path (Path) -- Path to network folder

  • links_var (list[str]) -- List of Links csv variables, must include "A" and "B"

  • nodes_var (list[str]) -- List of Nodes csv variables, must include "N", "X" and "Y"

Raises:

RuntimeError -- When Cube fails

Return type:

None

sysame.cube.cube.omx_to_mat(voyager_exe, omx_path, mat_path)[source]

Convert OMX Matrix to Cube MAT matrix

Parameters:

  • voyager_exe (Path) -- Path to voyager executable

  • omx_path (Path) -- Path to OMX matrix file

  • mat_path (Path) -- Path to Cube MAT matrix

Raises:

RuntimeError -- When Cube fails

Return type:

None

sysame.cube.cube.mat_to_omx(voyager_exe, mat_path, omx_path, compression=0)[source]

Convert Cube .MAT to OMX Matrix

Parameters:

  • voyager_exe (Path) -- Path to voyager executable

  • mat_path (Path) -- Path to Cube MAT matrix

  • omx_path (Path) -- Path to OMX matrix file

  • compression (int, default 0) -- Compression level of output matrix

Raises:

RuntimeError -- When Cube fails

Return type:

None

sysame.cube.cube.parse_cube_zones_character(cube_range)[source]

Parse Cube format list of zones/ranges into list of zones

Parameters:

cube_range (str) -- range of Cube style list/range of zones

Returns:

zones_list -- list of individual zones

Return type:

list[Any]

sysame.cube.cube.parse_sqex_file(sqex_file, level, sectors)[source]

Read Cube's SQEX file and create a lookup dataframe between zones and sectors.

NOTE: The function currently assumes a full weighting zones<>sectors. i.e. if a zone is split weighted across multiple sectors then the function will ignore that and take first appearance.

Parameters:

  • sqex_file (Path) -- path to the sqex file

  • level (str) -- the zone level either "stn" or "zone"

  • sectors (str) -- number of sectors

Returns:

sqex_df -- stn/zone to sectors lookup

Return type:

pl.DataFrame

Module for parsing Cube linefile into structured dataframes.

Bases: object

Class representing a file of lines.

A LineFile is a collection of line objects and comments.

Parameters:

content (list of (Line or str), optional) -- List of line objects and comment strings.

content

List containing line objects and comment strings.

Type:

list of (Line or str)

property content_duplicates_renamed: List[Line | str]

Returns the LineFile's content with duplicated NAMEs renamed.

Returns:

Copy of content with renamed lines.

Return type:

list

rename_duplicates()[source]

Changes the LineFile's content to avoid lines with duplicated NAMEs.

Return type:

None

property name_unique: bool

Returns True if lines' property "NAME" is a unique identifier.

Returns:

True if all line names are unique, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

property comments: List[str]

Returns the list of comments in the file.

Returns:

All comments in the file.

Return type:

list of str

property lines: Dict[str, Line]

Returns a dictionary of lines by NAME.

Returns:

Dictionary of lines with NAME as key.

Return type:

Dict[str, Line]

Returns a dictionary of lines with duplicated NAMEs renamed.

Returns:

Dictionary of lines with NAME as key, duplicates renamed.

Return type:

Dict[str, Line]

Returns a list of line names as strings.

Preserves order. May contain duplicates.

save(path, sort=False, comments=True, node_attrs=None, exclude_node_attrs=None, line_attrs=None, exclude_line_attrs=None, rename_duplicates=True)[source]

Save the LineFile to a file.

Parameters:

  • path (str) -- Path to the output file.

  • sort (bool, default=False) -- If True, sorts the output.

  • comments (bool, default=True) -- If True, includes comments in the output.

  • node_attrs (list of str, optional) -- List of node attributes to include.

  • exclude_node_attrs (list of str, optional) -- List of node attributes to omit.

  • line_attrs (list of str, optional) -- List of line attributes to include.

  • exclude_line_attrs (list of str, optional) -- List of line attributes to omit.

  • rename_duplicates (bool, default=True) -- If True, renames duplicate line names.

Return type:

None

Returns a list of lines having a specific value in an attribute.

  • val (Any) -- Value to match.

Returns:

List of lines that match the criteria.

List[Line]

lines_query(qry)[source]

Returns a list of lines meeting a SQL-like query.

This relies on pandas DataFrame query:

https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/generated/pandas.DataFrame.query.html

Parameters:

qry (str) -- SQL-like query string.

Returns:

List of lines that match the query.

Return type:

List[Line]
